text: As organizations grow, so do their volumes

of sensitive data that
need to be stored securely.

Organizations must comply
with growing data privacy regulations

and evolving guidance on
protecting their sensitive data.

This makes identifying and
protecting sensitive data at scale
complex, expensive and time-consuming.

Amazon Macie is a data security service
to help you address these challenges.

Macie discovers sensitive data
using machine learning and

pattern matching and provides
visibility into data security risks

and enables automated
protection against those risks.

When you enable Macie, the service
automatically provides an inventory

of Amazon S3 buckets and identifies
security risks, including buckets

that are unencrypted, publicly accessible
or shared outside your organization.

Next, Macie automatically samples
and analyzes objects in your S3 buckets,
inspecting them for sensitive data such

as personally identifiable information
like names and credit card numbers

builds an interactive data map of
where your sensitive data in S3 resides

across accounts and continuously updates
the data map as your data in S3 grows.

The interactive data map helps
you prioritize those security risks

that need immediate attention,
as well as guides your decisions

to perform deeper
investigations of specific S3 buckets

by running targeted,
sensitive data discovery jobs.

All Macie findings are sent to Amazon
EventBridge and can be published in

AWS Security Hub to initiate
automated remediation.

Macie continually adds to
its list of sensitive data types.
You can also define

your own data types to customize
it to your unique business need.

With multi-account support using
AWS Organizations, you can view
your data security posture

across your S3 environment from a
single Macie administrator account.

You can get started with Amazon
Macie today by leveraging the 30-day

free trial for automated
sensitive data discovery.
